author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: The Justice Department has taken the unusual step of launching a probe into one of its own investigations, assembling a federal grand jury in Maryland to review the mortgage fraud allegations made against Sen. Adam Schiff (D-Calif.). The probe raises questions for two top allies of President Trump: Ed Martin, who has been tapped as…
title: DOJ opens probe into handling of Schiff mortgage investigation

author: Al Weaver
description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune (R-S.D.) said Thursday he did not agree with President Trump’s suggestion that a group of Democratic lawmakers be locked up or punished by death after they urged military service members to resist unlawful orders. Thune decried the comments made by the group of Democrats, all of whom served as military…
title: Thune: ‘I certainly don’t agree’ with Trump suggesting death penalty for Democrats

author: Max Rego
description: Unfortunately, “6-7” has reached the House floor. Rep. Blake Moore (R-Utah) thought it was a good idea Tuesday to use the slang term, which has been increasingly used by teenagers to describe, well, anything. Moore, serving as Speaker pro tempore, asked for those in the chamber to vote yea or nay on a measure. Then,…
title: GOP rep does ‘6-7’ gesture while presiding over House

author: Julia Shapero
description: The Senate Agriculture Committee on Thursday voted to advance President Trump’s new pick to lead the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC), a low-profile agency that is poised to take on a key role regulating cryptocurrency.  The panel voted 12-11 along partisan lines to send Mike Selig’s nomination to the Senate floor, just one day after…
title: Senate panel advances Trump’s pick to chair key crypto regulator

author: Tara Suter
description: Comedian Jon Stewart went after President Trump and tech leaders over a visit this week with Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman. “Jon, what do you think about all of the CEOs attending the White House dinner for MBS [Mohammed bin Salman]?” Brittany Mehmedovic, Stewart’s producer, asked on his “The Weekly Show with Jon Stewart”…
title: Jon Stewart rips Trump, tech leaders over Saudi crown prince visit

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Democratic senators clashed with Senate Majority Leader John Thune (R-S.D.) on the Senate floor Thursday when the GOP leader proposed a resolution to clarify that any damages won by Republican senators from lawsuits against the Department of Justice (DOJ) would go to the U.S. Treasury and not to the senators’ bank accounts. Responding to complaints…
title: Fight erupts on Senate floor over provision letting senators reap millions from suing DOJ

author: Surina Venkat
description: The Council on American-Islamic Relations’s (CAIR) legal arm has filed a lawsuit challenging Texas Gov. Greg Abbott’s (R) designation of their group as a “foreign terrorist organization” — a stance at odds with the U.S. government. CAIR is the nation’s largest Muslim civil rights advocacy organization, according to a description on its website. The organization’s…
title: CAIR sues Texas over terrorist designation

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Thursday the United States has assured his country’s “qualitative advantage” in the Middle East despite President Trump’s plan to sell F-35 advanced fighter jets to Saudi Arabia. The sale concerned Israeli and some U.S. officials about whether it could destabilize Israel’s so-called qualitative military edge (QME), which Congress has…
title: Netanyahu says Israel will keep ‘qualitative advantage’ despite F-35 sale to Saudi Arabia

author: Rachel Frazin
description: The Energy Department announced a reorganization on Thursday that it says will better reflect the Trump administration’s priorities. An organizational chart released to the public no longer lists the Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy. According to the department, this office will be renamed as the newly established Office of Critical Minerals and Energy Innovation. That…
title: Energy Department reorganizes, a move it says will help it align with Trump priorities

author: Kaitlin Flanigan
description: It was a shocking moment last week at Portland International Airport when a person passed through security with a meat cleaver in their carry-on bag.
title: TSA conducting review after passenger gets meat cleaver through security

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: A senior adviser to former President Biden slammed the Democratic Party for its “betrayal” of the leader during the 2024 campaign.  “There have been three people who ran against Donald Trump, Joe Biden was the only one who ever beat him. I thought what happened in the party was disloyal, I thought it was an…
title: Senior Biden adviser knocks Democrats’ ‘betrayal’: ‘It was disloyal’

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Former presidents, vice presidents and other elected officials gathered on Thursday to mourn former Vice President Dick Cheney at Washington National Cathedral. Former President George W. Bush, former Rep. Liz Cheney (R-Wyo.), former Assistant Defense Secretary Pete Williams, the vice president’s longtime physician Jonathan Reiner and three of his grandchildren all delivered eulogies. Here are five notable moments…
title: 5 notable moments from Dick Cheney’s funeral

author: Joseph Choi
description: Sen. Bill Cassidy (R-La.) on Thursday said the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) removing language from its website refuting the theory that vaccines are linked to autism was “deeply troubling.” Late on Wednesday, the CDC walked back its long-held position that vaccines do not cause autism. A CDC web page that previously stated…
title: Cassidy calls HHS change to vaccine-autism language ‘deeply troubling’

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Three more Indiana state Senate Republicans reported this week that they were victims of swatting incidents amid a push from national Republicans to have GOP holdouts change their minds about redistricting. Indiana GOP Sens. Dan Dernulc, Spencer Deery and Rick Niemeyer all said they were victims of different swatting incidents. Swatting involves someone reporting a…
title: 3 more Indiana Republicans report swatting incidents amid redistricting push

author: Max Rego
description: Rep. Sheila Cherfilus-McCormick (D-Fla.) has come under fire on Capitol Hill after a grand jury indicted her for allegedly stealing Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) funds to bankroll her campaign.  Prosecutors allege that the South Florida congresswoman and her brother, Edwin, received a $5 million overpayment from FEMA in July 2021, while their health care…
title: Who is Rep. Sheila Cherfilus-McCormick, Democrat indicted for alleged FEMA fraud?

author: Filip Timotija
description: The Coast Guard said Thursday a Washington Post report that claimed it will no longer classify swastikas and nooses as hate symbols is “categorically false.” “The claims that the U.S. Coast Guard will no longer classify swastikas, nooses or other extremist imagery as prohibited symbols are categorically false. These symbols have been and remain prohibited in the…
title: Coast Guard denies report it won’t classify swastikas, nooses as hate symbols

author: Ellen Mitchell
description: The White House says Army Secretary Dan Driscoll felt optimistic following a meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, who is now planning to speak with President Trump about the 28-point peace plan reportedly hashed out mostly with Russia in recent weeks.  “Sec. Driscoll did meet with President Zelensky today,” White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt…
title: US Army chief ‘optimistic’ as Trump, Zelensky expected to discuss 28-point peace plan

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Minnesota State Sen. Erin Maye Quade (D) on Thursday slammed President Trump after he called six Democratic lawmakers “traitors” and suggested their request to military service members to disobey unlawful orders could put them in prison and is punishable by death. “A Trump supporter started murdering his way through an assassination list of Democratic law…
title: Minnesota state senator on Trump sedition remarks: ‘I cannot describe how f—ing dangerous this is’

author: Tara Suter
description: Sen. Chris Murphy (D-Conn.) on Thursday urged influential Americans to “pick a f—ing side” after President Trump referred to a group of Democrats as “traitors.” “The President of the United States just called for Democratic members of Congress to be executed. ‘HANG THEM’, he posted,” Murphy said in a post on the social platform X.…
title: Murphy urges influential Americans to ‘pick a f—ing side’ after Trump ‘seditious’ posts

author: Caroline Vakil
description: New Jersey Gov.-elect Mikie Sherrill (D) will resign from her seat in the House on Thursday, with current Gov. Phil Murphy (D) expected to call for a special election to replace her on Friday. In a letter addressed to Murphy on Tuesday and posted on the social platform X, Sherrill told the New Jersey governor she…
title: Sherrill to resign from House seat on Thursday

author: Julia Manchester
description: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt swiped at New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani ahead of his visit to the nation’s capital on Friday, echoing President Trump in calling him “a communist.”  “It speaks volumes that tomorrow we have a communist coming to the White House because that’s who the Democrat Party elected as the…

author: Mike Lillis
description: A Texas Democrat is vowing to introduce new articles of impeachment against President Trump before year’s end. Rep. Al Green (D-Texas) declined to say how many articles he will craft or what actions of the president he will target. But he’s promising to force a vote on his resolutions before Congress leaves Washington for the…
title: Democrat Al Green vows another push to impeach Trump next month

author: Rachel Frazin
description: The Trump administration proposed on Thursday to open up new oil and gas drilling off the coast of California, a move that had already been denounced by Gov. Gavin Newsom (D). The administration also proposed opening to drilling an area that had been considered part of the eastern Gulf of Mexico, a plan that could…
title: Trump proposes to open up new drilling off California coast and in eastern Gulf

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Former Rep. Liz Cheney (R-Wyo.) paid tribute Thursday to her late father, former Vice President Dick Cheney, as a great statesman who put country over party and as a loving father who inspired in his family a deep sense of patriotism. In her eulogy at her father’s funeral service, Liz Cheney recalled comments the late…
title: Liz Cheney remembers father Dick Cheney as a ‘giant to the end’

author: Lindsey Granger, opinion contributor
description: How long can you run on “America First” while spending so much time everywhere else?
title: As poll numbers drop, Trump vows to end war in Sudan at request of Mohammed bin Salman

author: Surina Venkat
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said the United States has asked to join the Group of 20 (G20) summit at “the 11th hour” after previously announcing it would boycott the event. After the Trump administration’s “change of mind,” Ramaphosa said the summit was figuring out the logistics to accommodate the U.S. at the two-day event…
title: Trump administration reverses, wants to join G20 summit: South African president

author: Tara Suter
description: About half of Americans say that democracy is performing poorly, according to a new survey. The Charles F. Kettering Foundation/Gallup Democracy for All Project survey found that 51 percent of respondents claimed the “U.S. democracy is performing poorly,” while 24 percent claimed their country’s democracy “is performing well.” Twenty-five percent claimed the functioning of their…
title: About half say democracy performing poorly: Survey

author: The Hill Staff
description: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt will brief reporters Thursday afternoon, a day after President Trump signed legislation ordering the Justice Department to release all files related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Trump’s reversal on the disclosures last Sunday was unexpected after he asked Attorney General Pamela Bondi to launch an investigation into potential…
title: Watch live: White House briefs reporters after Trump signs bill to release Epstein files

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The brother of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein said Wednesday the disgraced financier spoke with President Trump after the 2016 election.  “Jeffrey told me that Trump — it was after the election that Trump called him, and it was sort of like, ‘Can you believe this?’ Because nobody believed Trump was going to win,” Mark…
title: Mark Epstein says his brother Jeffrey spoke with Trump after 2016 election

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Rising sea levels could flood thousands of hazardous sites in marginalized communities mostly across seven states by 2100 should greenhouse gases continue to build up in the atmosphere, a study published Thursday in Nature Communications warns. Flooding could strike 5,500 sites and release contaminants should flood waters hit these sites. Eighty percent of the sites…
title: Sea level rise threatens thousands of hazardous sites: Study

description: Rising sea levels could flood thousands of hazardous sites in marginalized communities mostly across seven states by 2100 should greenhouse gases continue to build up in the atmosphere, a new study published in Nature Communications on Thursday warns. description: The officer uses his radio to tell dispatchers, "We have a suspect with a dog. The dog is not responding to our commands … neither is he."
title: ‘I will blow your dog away,’ San Francisco officer tells man before shooting

description: The move has sparked concern among lawmakers in the state.

description: Under the directive of an intelligence program, the U.S. Border Patrol is monitoring millions of American drivers to identify and arrest those accused of suspicious travel patterns. Drivers’ license plates are scanned and recorded by a network of cameras, while an algorithm flags vehicles seen as suspicious based on their place of origin, their destination…
title: Border Patrol monitoring drivers, looking for suspicious travel patterns: Report

author: Tara Suter
description: Rep. Tim Burchett (R-Tenn.) lashed out Wednesday against a group of people in a TikTok video that flipped off President Trump. “Get off your fat a‑‑,” Burchett said in a post on the social platform X. “I am tired of carrying you.” Burchett’s post, which was highlighted by Mediaite, came in response to another post…
title: GOP rep to TikTokers flipping off Trump: ‘Get off your fat a‑‑’

description: President Trump on Thursday called a group of Democrats “traitors” and suggested they be locked up, and punished by death after the lawmakers urged members of the military to resist unlawful orders by the administration. Trump was responding to a video, made by six Democrats with military and intelligence backgrounds, that speaks directly to those…
title: Trump deems Dems ‘traitors’ over calls for military to resist unlawful orders

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Major League Baseball (MLB) plans to comply with a request from Congress to provide documents and testimony on how it will address concerns about illegal gambling and game rigging, commissioner Rob Manfred said this week. “We’re going to respond fully and cooperatively and on time to the Senate inquiry,” Manfred told reporters on Wednesday. He…

description: Such recall delays raise questions whether public safety is taking a back seat to corporate profits.

description: Former Vice President Dick Cheney, who died last month at the age of 84, will be honored Thursday during a funeral service at Washington National Cathedral. Tributes will be delivered by former President George W. Bush and former Rep. Liz Cheney (R-Wyo.), the late vice president’s daughter, among others. Former President Biden and Speaker Emerita…

description: A man has been federally charged after a woman was set on fire while riding on a CTA Blue Line train Monday night.

description: A sitting vice president is the worst position to be in when running for president.

description: Former President Biden is set to make a rare public appearance Thursday to attend the funeral for former Vice President Dick Cheney in Washington. A spokesperson for the former president confirmed that he would be among the dignitaries in attendance at the Washington National Cathedral. Biden succeeded Cheney as vice president in 2009. He will…

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Rep. Ro Khanna (D-Calif.) on Wednesday called on the Department of Justice (DOJ) to release all of its documents on convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein following passage of legislation by Congress earlier this week. “This is a victory for the brave survivors, but it is just the beginning,” Khanna told NewsNation. “Now we must keep…

author: Sylvan Lane
description: The U.S. added 119,000 jobs in September as the unemployment rate rose to 4.4 percent, according to data released Thursday by the Bureau of Labor Statistics, more than six weeks after it was initially set to be published. The September jobs report, which was delayed by the federal government shutdown, showed the U.S. labor market…
title: US added 119K jobs in September after August decline, delayed report shows

author: Celina Stewart and Lucille Wenegieme, opinion contributors
description: When it comes to registering voters, history has shown us one thing again and again: Government alone is not enough.
title: Ending voter registration at citizenship ceremonies tarnishes democracy

description: New York Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani (D) said he plans to talk about inflation during his Friday meeting with President Trump inside the Oval Office.  “I want to just speak plainly to the president about what it means to actually stand up for New Yorkers and the way in which New Yorkers are struggling to afford…

author: Max Rego
description: A bipartisan group of House lawmakers has sent a letter to online commerce platform Shein, expressing concern that its website was used to facilitate the sale of childlike sex dolls in the U.S.  The letter, obtained by The Hill, was sent Wednesday to Shein CEO Yangtian “Chris” Xu. It was signed by 34 lawmakers 29…

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Former White House lawyer Ty Cobb on Wednesday said Attorney General Pam Bondi and interim U.S. Attorney Lindsey Halligan should be disbarred over the Department of Justice’s (DOJ) case against former FBI Director James Comey. Speaking with anchor Chris Jansing on MS NOW, formerly MSNBC, Cobb said it was “shocking” that the indictment “was never properly returned,” which made the…
title: Ty Cobb says Bondi, Halligan should be disbarred over Comey case

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) on Wednesday called on Secretary of State Marco Rubio to brief the Senate as the Trump administration ramps up military operations against Venezuela. “I’m demanding @SecRubio provide an All-Senators classified briefing on Trump’s military buildup and reported plans for military operations in Venezuela,” Schumer posted on the social media…
title: Schumer calls for Rubio to brief Senate on plans for military operations in Venezuela

author: Emily Brooks
description: The House on Wednesday unanimously passed a bill repealing a new law that would allow senators to sue for substantial sums if they aren’t notified when law enforcement seeks their phone records. The House passed repeal of the law in a resounding 426-0 vote that served as a signal of the bipartisan outrage about the…
title: House unanimously passes repeal of phone records provision that could enrich senators

author: Ryan Mancini
description: The funeral for former Vice President Cheney, one of the most influential figures in American politics over the last century, will be held at Washington National Cathedral on Thursday. Cheney, 84, died on Nov. 4 due to complications of pneumonia and cardiac and vascular disease, his family said. “Vice President Cheney devoted decades of his…
title: Who is expected to attend Dick Cheney’s funeral?
